data.name: Isaiah 188
data.detailed_description:
GET ORBITAL

"What are those new lights in the sky?"
Give new meaning to the phrase "shooting stars" with unique orbital grids around many different planets and moons in our solar system. Every fleet is always moving! Speed them up, slow them down, flip their orbital direction, or transfer orbits. But be careful, every ship can run out of delta-V.

"Ceres won't always be a short ride out; she's moving too."
Send your fleets across the vast and lonely reaches to all the populated bodies in one game world. Crossing millions of miles takes time, though, and that means those reinforcements to Jupiter won't get there fast - no matter how hard the burn.

"It's not speed that kills - it's the sudden railgun impact at the bottom that gets ya."
Space combat is true "fly by" newtonian combat, with relative velocities taken into account, and weapon ranges based on whether the other ships can dodge. Distances are measured in light milliseconds, many thousands of miles, and combat can be over in seconds too. Your captains and crews do the fighting for you, but you must make key strategic decisions before combat starts.

GET TACTICAL

With dozens of ground units across infantry, vehicles, and aircraft, and seven capital ship types, (not to mention massive defense and construction stations!) there's tons of room to build the armies you want and the fleets you need.
"Heavy battleships command space, peerless and fearless, and nimble corvettes chase fat transport ships like orcas on the hunt. It's a good time to be in the navy."

Ground combat on traditional hex grids requires cunning when planning maneuvers and attacking. Flank your enemies for large combat bonuses, and tailor your forces to counter the enemy to ensure victory.


"That spec ops squad giving you trouble? Surround it with killer drones!"

Every planet and moon has a different terrain mix, so maybe don't truck three transports full of heavy tanks to icy, scarred Europa. Try mechs instead!


"We all know mechs are impractical, but who can say no to plasma swords and spider mechs and shoulder mounted cannons? Did I mention there are space penguins on Enceladus? Why not!"

TWO WAYS TO PLAY

Isaiah 188 has three campaigns, one for each of the factions. The other main mode in Isaiah 188 is Solar Conquest, which starts in 2257 with realistic planetary orbits and positions. Choose a starting scenario and your faction, and secure the future of your people by any means necessary!

THE FACTIONS

  • The Martian Commonwealth, or more accurately, the MCVCM - their military. A laser focus on AI and cloning has given Mars a definite technologic edge over Earth. "It means 'Martial Commonwealth Volume Control Military,' and I unabashedly made the acronym first and decided what it stood for second."

  • The United Nations Solar Expeditionary Force, or UN-SOLEXFOR. Earth's people are fractured and the planet is sick, but ten thousand years of warrior culture are not so easily ignored. "It doesn't hurt that there are thirteen billion of them either."

  • A strange alien presence, calling themselves the "Haptha Garden Song," have appeared out in the farthest reaches past Neptune. "The free colonies have gone dark, and their silence screams a declaration of war."

THE MUSIC

Call me biased, but I think my composer did an absolutely stupendous job. The soundtrack is awesome, give it a listen and support independent music creators when you get a chance (and the game is actually out!)

WORK WITH ME

So, I decided not to do early access, because at 1:30 am I said, "I'm thinking about early access," and my wife said "probably not." However, given that I'm just one guy with just one brain for ideas, and parts of this game are actually novel like the orbital grid and there's no genre precedent to riff off, I'm excited to see what cool stuff the community comes up with for me to add in.

Want to fight around the Sun? Maybe someday! Board ships? No! Anyways, let me know what you think would be cool. Do note that the game, when it ships, will be feature complete as originally envisioned by me. I do plan to support the game post launch with bug fixes and updates, but mostly I'm simply excited to hear what people come up with that could be cool and add it in!

data.short_description: Fight on the ground and in space around 17 different bodies in our solar system with unique lite orbital mechanics. Recruit armies, build fleets, and conquer the solar system as one of three unique factions in this turn based strategy game!

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 7
  • Processor: 2.5 gHz i7
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 970
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Sound Card: yes
  • Additional Notes: Run the game in fullscreen for optimal results.
